preqs: Must have passed 12 credit points at Year 1.

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {TAD1101, TAD1102, TAD1203, TAD1206, TAD1301, TAD1302, TAD2214}

unitName: Constructing art in Australia: colonialism to postcolonialism 2
description: This unit is a study of visual practices within Australia from colonisation to contemporary contexts. The unit will address issues of representation, nationalism and nationhood, multiculturalism, ethnicity, aboriginalty and gender. The position of the Australian artists in negotiating cultural identity is a central concern. Indigenous artistic practices and urban aboriginal and urban aboriginal art will be considered, as well as post-modern visual and cirtical practices that cut across boundaries and explore new modes of representation.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
